channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Israel’s war on Gaza: List of key events, day 176
item.description: Israeli attacks kill dozens of Palestinians including 15 people at a sport centre where war-displaced were sheltering.

item.title: Land Day: What happened in Palestine in 1976?
item.description: Every year on March 30, Palestinians demonstrate their commitment to resisting Israeli occupation.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 765
item.description: As the war enters its 765th day, these are the main developments.

item.title: ‘Pure veg fleet’: How Indian food app Zomato sparked a caste, purity debate
item.description: Delivery workers worry that vegetarian-only fleets today could pave the way for caste-based delivery systems tomorrow.

item.title: Gaza war reminds Vietnam of liberation struggle once shared with Palestine
item.description: Israel's war on Gaza spurs Vietnam’s youth to rediscover solidarity with Palestinians and a shared revolutionary past.

item.title: Senegal’s top court confirms Bassirou Diomaye Faye’s election victory
item.description: The 44-year-old will be inaugurated to replace Macky Sall, who ruled the West African nation for 12 years.

item.title: How Wisconsin advocates hope to use ‘uncommitted’ votes to pressure Biden
item.description: Wisconsin's April 2 primary will be latest forum for a movement hoping to force Biden to change his stance on Gaza war.

item.title: Russia mulls labelling queen of Soviet pop Pugacheva a ‘foreign agent’
item.description: Musician Alla Pugacheva, who is currently abroad, has criticised the Kremlin for its actions in Ukraine.

item.title: ‘Overwhelmed in joy’: Texas court overturns woman’s voter fraud conviction
item.description: Rights advocates welcome ruling overturning Crystal Mason's conviction as victory in 'broader fight for voting rights'.

item.title: Russian teen honoured with Muslim medal
item.description: Teen receives Russian Muslim Medal for helping to save over 100 lives during the concert hall shooting outside Moscow.

item.title: Will the ICJ’s latest orders help Palestinians under attack in Gaza?
item.description: Israel has ignored previous International Court of Justice rulings about its war on Gaza.

item.title: Mexico debates a rising political party’s ‘New Deal’ for the poor
item.description: The Morena party and its outgoing populist president, Lopez Obrador, are raising Mexicans' 'revolutionary consciousness'

item.title: Nine detained in Tajikistan in relation to Moscow concert hall attack
item.description: A Russian court meanwhile charged one more suspect in last week's deadly attack on Crocus City Hall.

item.title: Family mourns man who drowned retrieving aid in Gaza
item.description: Yusuf Ghaben drowned this week in the sea while attempting to retrieve airdropped aid to feed his starving family.

item.title: Northern Ireland DUP leader Jeffrey Donaldson resigns after police charges
item.description: Media reports say the charges against the Democratic Unionist Party head relate to 'non-recent sexual offences'.

item.title: How US police are co-opting a law meant to protect victims of crime
item.description: Experts fear law enforcement is using Marsy’s Law to hide names and dodge accountability in cases of police violence.

item.title: Photos: Israeli air raids kill dozens across the Gaza Strip
item.description: At least 32,600 Palestinians have been killed by Israel since October 7, with 71 killed in the last 24 hours.

item.title: Ramaphosa: We are pleased and sad over ICJ outcome
item.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa is saddened that Israel did not heed the ICJ order to prevent genocide in Gaza

item.title: Sudan slips into famine as warring sides starve civilians
item.description: Without online remittances, soaring prices and cereal production cut, Sudan is in the middle of a humanitarian disaster.

item.title: Could OpenAI’s Sora text-to-video generator kill off jobs in Hollywood?
item.description: Some say it's 'game over' for creative professionals in the film industry.

item.title: John Mearsheimer: Israel lobby’s influence on US policy as powerful as ever
item.description: Marc Lamont Hill talks to scholar John Mearsheimer about US foreign policy and its support for Israel and Ukraine.

item.title: Biden says he is working to free US journalist jailed by Russia a year ago
item.description: Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich is accused of spying, a charge the US dismisses as 'fiction'.

item.title: Protesters interrupt Biden fundraiser over Gaza war
item.description: Protesters against the war in Gaza interrupted a major election campaign fundraiser for President Joe Biden.

item.title: Thai court acquits dozens who shut down Bangkok airports in 2008
item.description: ‘Yellow Shirt’ antigovernment protesters protected under the constitution, charges of rebellion and terrorism dropped.

item.title: How have feminist voices evolved beyond the West?
item.description: As we mark Women’s History Month, what does feminism look like when we recentre sidelined voices from the Global South?
